CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 with regard to the length of the proceedings;Inadmissible under Art. 6-1 with regard to the other complaints;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses (Convention proceedings) - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE ) . He is a practising lawyer by profession .

CARDINAL . On DATE a colleague , PERSON , laid a disciplinary information against the applicant alleging that he had infringed the profession ’s honour and reputation in the context of administrative criminal proceedings relating to traffic offences . He was suspected of having misbehaved towards intervening police officers during a traffic control by threatening them with job - related troubles in case they charged him with traffic offences . Subsequently , on DATE ORG of ORG ( NORP der PERSON ) , upon request of ORG ( PERSON ) , appointed an Investigating Commissioner ( PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Investigating Commissioner informed the applicant that disciplinary proceedings against him were opened and requested him to file observations as regards the charges against him .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complied with this request .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Investigating Commissioner submitted a report to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings against the applicant . ORG Prosecutor filed an appeal against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted his observations on the appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON Berufungs- und ORG ) allowed ORG Prosecutor ’s appeal and remitted the case to ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE , after the case had been taken over by another Investigating Commissioner , the latter agreed with ORG ) to question the police officers involved in the traffic control at issue by way of letters rogatory . On DATE he filed letters rogatory with ORG ( Bezirksgericht ) which were subsequently transferred to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the CARDINAL police officers were questioned by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Investigating Commissioner submitted his report to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , upon the Investigating Commissioner ’s report , decided to open the main proceedings . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed his observations .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG fixed a hearing for DATE and summoned the applicant , his spouse and the QUANTITY police officers . As the applicant ’s spouse and one police officers submitted that they could not appear at that date , the hearing was cancelled .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , in proceedings unrelated to the present one ’s , issued a decision concerning the composition of ORG . On DATE , after an internal discussion of the consequences of ORG decision for the proceedings at issue , Mr F was appointed as new chairman of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG fixed a hearing for DATE . The applicant ’s spouse and the QUANTITY police officers submitted that they could not appear at that date .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed observations and challenged the chairman and another member of ORG for bias .
CARDINAL . On DATE a new chairman was appointed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing . The applicant requested to summon his spouse for the next hearing . ORG adjourned the case and decided to obtain the file concerning the administrative criminal proceedings against the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested ORG to submit the file concerning the administrative criminal proceedings against the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE , since the file at issue had meanwhile been transmitted to an other administrative authority , ORG filed a new request to submit the file .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG fixed a hearing for DATE . The applicant again challenged a member of ORG for bias .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing . The only witness heard was one of the QUANTITY police officers , the other witnesses and the applicant submitted that they were not able to appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG fixed another hearing for DATE . The applicant again challenged CARDINAL members of ORG for bias and submitted that he was prevented from appearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing and convicted the applicant under section CARDINAL LAW . It found that he had misbehaved towards intervening police officers during a traffic control by threatening them with job - related troubles in case they charged him with traffic offences . The applicant had thereby infringed the profession ’s honour and reputation . ORG ordered him to pay an additional fine of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL as he had already been ordered to pay ORG CARDINAL in CARDINAL other sets of disciplinary proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an appeal against this decision and on DATE ORG Prosecutor submitted his observations in reply .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG ) . He complained , inter alia , about the length of the proceedings and claimed that the disciplinary authorities had failed to take the excessive length of the proceedings into account as a mitigating circumstance .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW ( Rechtsanwaltsordung ) provides that a practising lawyer is obliged to preserve the honour and reputation of the profession by his honest and sincere conduct .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW ( GPE ) , in the version applicable at the material time , provided for the following disciplinary penalties : a written reprimand , a fine of up to ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL , a prohibition on practising as a lawyer for a period not exceeding one year and being struck off the bar roll .
